comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
`Get-Command`'s (implied) `-Name` parameter accepts wildcard patterns (as many parameters across PowerShell cmdlets do).

While file-processing cmdlets have separate `-LiteralPath` parameters that allow you to explicitly distinguish between a pattern and a verbatim argument, `Get-Command` only has `-Name`, so in order to prevent `?` from being interpreted as a pattern, you must _escape_ it - which isn't too obvious, unfortunately:

```powershell
PS> Get-Command '`?'  # or: ``?

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Alias           ? -> Where-Object                                             
```

That is, the `` ` `` must be a literal part of the name passed to `Get-Command` - it is literal from a string-processing perspective, but in the context of wildcard-pattern matching it then serves as the escape character.

Conceptually, the above is the equivalent of:

```powershell
Get-Command ([WildcardPattern]::Escape('?'))
```
